alert.note: Alert for Crittenden; Mississippi (Arkansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Memphis (Western Tennessee, Eastern Arkansas and Northern Mississippi)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 18 at 5:09AM CDT by NWS Memphis
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southwestern Mississippi, northeastern Crittenden, northeastern DeSoto, northwestern Marshall, Tipton, western Fayette and Shelby Counties through 600 AM CDT... At 508 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from Joiner to near Frayser to near Horn Lake. Movement was east at 50 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Bartlett, Southaven, Collierville, Germantown, Olive Branch, West Memphis, Horn Lake, Millington, Covington, T O Fuller State Park, Meeman Shelby Forest State Park, Cordova, Memphis, Lakeland, Arlington, Munford, Somerville, Brighton, Joiner and Bassett. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 1000 AM CDT for eastern Arkansas...northwestern Mississippi...and west Tennessee.
